result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Arpke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: A.R. at the rate of at least $500.00 per month.
Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not then perform 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment,treatment,counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: SAFE Program Discharge Summary

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:46 am 
INCLUDES 14CF956, 15CF287, AND 15CF333. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Dave Casey.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State files amended information in 15CF333. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF956: Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF287: Ct. 1 (Issue of Worthless Checks)>>D&RI. 
                   : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF956: Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF333: Ct. 1 (Theft - False Representation)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Misd. Theft)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. Theft)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty on Ct. 3 in 14CF956 and Cts. 2 & 3 in 15CF333, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in 15CF333. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF333 on Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement - State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ, it will move to dismiss the charge. 
In 14CF956 on Ct. 3 and in 15CF333 on Ct.  3>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
In 15CF333 on Ct. 2>>6 months MCJ  imposed and STAYED for 2 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS: as CONDITIONS on ALL probationary periods: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; restitution of $22,582 to A.R. at a rate of at least $500 per month; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS: as a CONDITION of probation on Ct. 3 in 15CF333 ONLY: 60 days MCJ imposed and STAYED to be used at agent's discretion and with approval of the court. 

COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
Review of DEOJ set for August 17, 2018 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.   No contact with victim(s): J.K.
